author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Repo URL does not end with /name.jl.git, where name is the package name
- Package name similar to 1 existing package.
  1. Similar to FreeType. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Hi 
I got this error while auto merge 
```
┌ Info: Name is not too similar to existing package names
│   meets_this_guideline = false
└   message = "Package name similar to 1 existing package.\n  1. Similar to FreeType. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2."
```
I don't want to change the package's name as the package was there on GitHub with this name for the past 2 years.
The name suite well to the use case. 
`FreeType` is quite different from `FileType`

The name similarity is fine. You'll need to take care of the other issues, though.

[noblock]

>You'll need to take care of the other issues, though.

fixed

[noblock]

Perhaps the name shoule be `FileTypes` instead, and then you can rename the internal type to `FileType`. (See point 3 in the guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines).

<!-- [noblock] -->

>Perhaps the name should be FileTypes instead, and then you can rename the internal type to FileType. (See point 3 in the guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines).

Thanks for the feedback, I will do the required changes.

body:
- Registering package: FileType
- Repository: https://github.com/JuliaIO/FileTypes.jl
- Created by: @Agent-Hellboy
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: 3efb87a6b53745e07ec18ac3a5300d1ebb840707
- Reviewed by: @Agent-Hellboy
- Reference: https://github.com/JuliaIO/FileTypes.jl/issues/2#issuecomment-1331749646
- Description: Small and dependency-free Julia package to infer file and MIME type checking the magic numbers signature.

title: New package: FileType v0.1.0
